docs.lead_paragraph: Jefferies said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire Prudential Bache's Global Commodities Group from Prudential Financial for $430 million.

docs.abstract: The $430 million deal is the latest step in a wide-ranging expansion by the securities firm.

docs.lead_paragraph: As promised, after yesterday's praise, a few initial criticisms. The basic architecture of the budget, I think, is exactly right: It means-tests Medicare and shifts the program from an open-ended entitlement to a defined benefit; it block-grants Medicaid to the states (something that governors of both parties have wanted for a long time); and it promises to lower tax rates while broadening the tax base, which is the essence of any good tax reform. But inevitably, there are devils in the details. Here are three obvious problems.
docs.abstract: Three problems with the Republican deficit plan.
docs.snippet: Three problems with the Republican deficit plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Brooks: Gail, what do you think of Paul Ryan's budget proposal and the budget fights of the next year? I don't expect that you'll like the specifics of his Medicare and Medicaid reforms. But do you admire him for having the guts to not only touch the third rail of American politics but to sort of cover himself in copper and wallow around on it?
docs.abstract: Medicare, Medicaid, Social Security, Paul Ryan and what exactly is the path to prosperity?
docs.snippet: Medicare, Medicaid, Social Security, Paul Ryan and what exactly is the path to prosperity?

byline.original: By DAVID BROOKS AND GAIL COLLINS

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of their budget proposal, Republican lawmakers are now talking about replacing the Medicare program with a private system that would rely on commercial insurers to provide coverage to the elderly instead of the federal government.
docs.abstract: Should insurers take over coverage for older people?
docs.snippet: Should insurers take over coverage for older people?

headline.main: Commerzbank to Repay $20.3 Billion of German Bailout

docs.abstract: Commerzbank says it will repay most of the aid it received from the German government in 2009 and sell new shares to strengthen its capital reserves and comply with new banking regulations.
docs.snippet: Commerzbank says it will repay most of the aid it received from the German government in 2009 and sell new shares to strengthen its capital reserves and comply with new banking regulations.

docs.lead_paragraph: The ideal of computerizing patient records is captured in the words behind the government's aspirational acronym, N.H.I.N., for Nationwide Health Information Network.
